parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Already; now at length, now after all this waiting. Apparently from e and de; even now.
Late, evening. From opse; late; feminine afternoon or nightfall.
Of time: when, after; of cause: since, because; otherwise: else. From epi and ei; thereupon, i.e. Since.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The day of preparation, the day before the Sabbath, Friday. As if from paraskeuazo; readiness.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The day before the Sabbath. From pro and sabbaton; a fore-sabbath, i.e. The Sabbath-eve.
